11.content:
The light shined with all its strength on the military headquarter of Central City, making all the smooth rock structure to be covered with a blinding white halo.

As always, Colonel Roy Mustang was sitting behind his desk, with a scowled face, while checking some documentation and fixing some bumf.
He was incredibly concentrated on his job, his head completely bent on the papers, when lieutenant Riza Hawkeye opened the door. The crackling caused Mustang to lift his head suddenly.

"Colonel Mustang. Sorry to disturb You, but the Elric brothers are here, as You asked."
"Very Well, make them enter."

Edward Elric, with a bored expression on his face, entered followed by his brother Alphonse, who overtopped him. He let his body fall on the soft green sofa in the middle of the office and then yawned.

"What the hell...why did you make us call so urgently? I hope it's something that worths it...."
"It does, fullmetal. Didn't you tell that the recent lack of job was getting you bored? Well, I have some job for you."

Then the colonel got up and gave to the young alchemist a ream of papers, and Edward began soon to leaf through it. They looked to be all dossiers of civilians, and each of them had their own photos and description. Underneath it there was a full summary of some investigations done and then a menacing bold type writing: "disappeared in mysterious circumstances".

"Disappearing people? Police should be involved in this, not army."
"If you had read more carefully those dossiers, fullmetal, probably you would have noticed that all these vanished people came all from villages of the Eastern Lands."
"Eastern lands, you said?"
"The recently conquered by the army lands, you mean?" Al said.
"Not exactly "conquered"." then Roy sat down again, putting his hands behind the head.
"We received the jurisdiction on these lands since a recent long-lasting situation of anarchy made them uncontrollable and potentially dangerous."
"I heard weird stories about those lands. I have shivers every time i recall them on my mind."
"Oh, come on, Al! Won't you really believe in some stupid ghost stories?"
"Uh, well, not.....uhm, sorry....." Al said, really embarassed and bending down his head ashamed.
If he had his real body, probably he would be in a slight cold sweat.
"Anyway, we think that these disappearances are not casual. We noticed that, in most of the cases, the victim was leaving his home or work place before vanishing, and that the event happened right after midnight or after one o'clock."
"Well, I don't think it's a coindicence, it almost seems there's a coordinated action. I wouldn't be surprised if a group or some criminal organization was behind this."
"We had a similar idea. But our investigation brought us to nowhere and, what's more, people is not happy to collaborate with foreigners, especially with soldiers.And this is where you make your entrance. Edward and Alphonse Elric, I want you to go to Eastern Lands and discover what's going on there. I want a complete report when you'll come back. I give you total carte blanche. You'll be leaving Central City tomorrow morning, if there's no problem. Any questions?"
"No, sir."
"Good. Keep the dossiers with you. You'll need them."

And then the Colonel dismissed the two Elric brothers, who were lead out of the office in the middle of the main corridor. The door behind them was closed with a slam.
"Wow! Great deal! He just called us to solve a minor case in which his unqualified minions failed."
"I wouldn't say so, brother. This thing looks to be serious. According to the papers number, many people have left without a trace."
"Yeah, probably you're right...."

He took the dossier again and gave another look to those people, and those strange photos. The incredible shadows under their eyes, those possesed faces, altogether with the deepest and longest wrinkles Edward had ever seen on the older victims, make those people appear more as plastic masks. A thing which unsettled him a little deep inside his soul.

"Ed? What should we do?"
"What?"
"I mean, what do you think we should do first? Mustang just gave us some informations, but we don't have still a good trail."
"Uhm....I had an half idea about that. Once arrived, we should..."
11.title: You chose Edward Elric

choices: ...Edward & Alphonse Elric. We're here by order of the Army HQ of Central City"

112.content:
"WHAT? Brother, you ain't talking seriously, are you?"
"Al, come on! Don't be so childish! You're far grown up for fairytales." Ed said, a little annoyed by his brother behaviour.
"Try to understand! Mustang just told us that these guys don't collaborate at all, right?"
"Uh, right...."
"And furthermore all the disappearances take place at about midnight - 1AM. Isn't it?"
"Well, that's true...."
"Good! Then visiting those places at that time will be enough to find out what's going on there!"
"Okay, but where do we begin? Eastern Lands are huge. And there are many villages and towns in that zone."
"Well, I noticed that most of the people in the dossier have vanished right in this town..."
Alphonse eye fell right on a line telling "Rauhsang", right were his brother right finger was pointing.
"...so our search will begin there."
“But it’ll be far more dangerous this way. Didn’t you think about it? I heard the most terrible things about those villages. The strangest events take place there, the most terrible and incredible ones. I saw some people who were telling around about their travels in those lands forgotten by God. You had to see their eyes, brother. I will never get those scared eyes out of my mind…”
“Stop it! I heard enough! Now look at my lips: those-things-does-not-exist. Got it?”
“Yeah, but…”
“Ok, then I don’t need to explain that anymore. I don’t want to hear that refrain again, is that ok?”
“Well, ok…” said Al, lowering his head. Ed whispered and then approached to his brother.
“Hey, Al…I want to be clear with you: I’m not treating you like an idiot, just trying to make you reason. They’re just legends. And, by the way, how many criminals we caught before? I’m sure this mission will be a piece of cake. So, are you ok?”
“Uh…yes, I am.” Al said, reassured by his brother attitude.
“Come on, let’s go to prepare what we could need for the travel.”
And they both walked fast through the corridor, reaching for the exit.

The rest of the day passed without nothing special happening. When Alphonse and Edward woke up the morning after the sun was still rising up in the sky and there were still stars hiding behind some thick cloud. After having clothed up, they got outside their home, where Havoc was waiting for them with a car. They left without hesitating. They didn’t talk much during the travel and Edward spent most of the time looking outside the window where he could see the country landscape changing into wide green forests with strong and tall trees, a brilliant curtain of leaves partially blocking the sunlight.

The car braked almost suddenly and this caused Ed and Al, who have fallen asleep in the meanwhile, to wake up almost jumping inside the car. With an upset and still half asleep face, Edward took a look at his clock, noticing that the car had stopped right after only two hours from when it left aunt Pinako’s home in Reezembool. Quite soon, Edward thought. He poked his head out of the window, just to see that they were in the middle of a huge desert dusty clearing. There was no trace of vegetation and the sky was covered with a menacing dark grey veil, making the air heavy. The only sign of life in all that desolation was an wooden house with some old coaches with horses parked near. Fullmetal was quite impressed by those ancient vehicles, and he recalled he had saw some of them just in one of those antique museums or in a nineteenth century paint.
“What does this mean, Havoc? Why did you stopped?”
“I’m sorry, guys, but I shall leave you here. From now on you have to keep on travelling in one of those coaches.”
“Uh? This is nonsense! You’re joking, right?”
“I’m not very good in jokes, Fullmetal. Furthermore these roads are incredibly bumpy and totally improper for cars. We could risk to break the oil pan.”
“I got it, but you could have let us take a train, instead of having this useless trip!”
“Well, if this can comfort you, there are no railways going through the Eastern Lands.”
“WHAAAAAT?” Ed and Al faces distorted in that full sense of surprise.
“Ok, then. It looks like you don’t need me anymore. Have a good trip. Oh, and send some postcard to the Colonel! He’d be glad…”
“Oh, sure! I can imagine….” Edward said, ironically.

Edward and Alphonse took their luggage out of the car, which, some minutes after, disappeared through the horizon mist. The two Elric brothers stood in silence for few seconds.
“It seems we have no choice, bro…we have to take that coach.” Al said.
“Al, when you talked about “land forgotten by Gods”, did you mean the fact these guys cannot even afford a railway?”
“Well, not exactly.” Al said, a little embarrassed.
“Ok, ok, I get it. Let’s take this stupid coach and make this thing quick.”
They reached the coach park with slow steps. They strangely noticed that nobody was there.
“Hey, is there anyone here?” Al screamed, but nobody answered. All he could hear was just his echoing voice through the vast moor.

“Hehehehe…HEHEHEHE!”
“WHAT THE….!”
“WHAT WAS THAT?”
“Ehehe….hello to you, strangers! Ehehe…and welcome…ehehe….how can I help you? Ehehe…”
The screeching laughter coming from Elric’s brother back was an old little man’s. His head appeared to be incredibly big, if compared to the tiny skeleton-like body. But the petrifying thing was his hugely developed forehead and his left eye, bigger and more rounded than the right one, in which a clear grey iris loomed, constantly watching the two alchemists.
“Uh…sorry, sir, but we’d like to rent one of your carriages. You see, we’re going to Rauhsang…”
“Eheheh…Rauhsang, you said…ehehe….I see….eheheh…follow me….ehehe….” That strange creature said, with his almost metallic and hoarse voice.
Then, limping conspicuously, he led the two brothers inside the old structure, into a huge almost empty room. Most of the wood panels were half broken or full of holes, and screeched under the footsteps of the two alchemists, while many dark corners were full of spider web and had few cavities, probably lairs for mice. The old man sat behind a big dark desk and opened a dusty registry. Many of the papers had nibbled edges and their surface was thickened by the halo of dirt and some big stains on them.
“First…eheheh…I have to know your name…eheheh…and where you come from…eheheh….strangers.”
“Oh, right.” Edward mumbled.
“We are…”

1122.content:
"Eheheh....tourists, you said, uh?...eheheh...."
"Yes, of course. Our names are...uh....." Edward suddenly blocked. He didn't have much fantasy for fake names.
"I'm...I'm Armand and this is my brother Edwin. Yeah, that's right! We're the two Algard brothers!"
"Edwin Algard and Armand Algard...eheheh...I see. Eheheh..."
"Phew! Thank you, brother!" Ed whispered.
"You're welcome."
The old man, with his mouth half open, showing off his rotten teeth and letting a thread of drool falling down slowly, wrote the names on the registry, moving his arm as if he was getting lots of little electrical shocks.
Al couldn't get his eyes off of that monster, those mannequin moves and affected manners, and his eye, God, that big white eye, come up from the worst nightmares.
Ed took off some money from his pockets and then he and Alphonse were led to one of the coaches behind the house, the best one, according to the owner. The horses seemed to be big and strong, but the coach wasn't in a good condition at all: the internal was completely dusty and uncleaned, while the cushion seat had some big rips and even some spring coming out of it.
"Woah! If this is the best coach, I can't dare to imagine how the other ones are..."
"Probably they would go in pieces right after some meters..." Al and Ed grimly said.
"Hey, wait a moment! Where is the coachman?"
"Eheheheh.....it's easy.....eheheh...there's no coachman...eheheh....you'll have to drive it by yourself...eheheh....good luck, kid!"
"WHO'S THE LITTLE BACTERIUM YOU CANNOT SEE EVEN WITH A MICROSCOPE, EH?!?"
"Come on, bro, he just said "kid"...." Al said and, noticing that Ed wasn't listening to him, he picked him up by grabbing his coat and he threw him inside the coach. The door closed right after. Al then reached the coachdriver seat and, with a strong whip, made the horse rear up and run as if they were chased by the devil himself.

As Al continued to whip the horses, he kept on driving the coach making the horse go straight on on the road. Inside the coach, Edward was jerking up and down, as the hollows followed, hit by the coach wheels.

"I-i-i-if I e-e-ever come b-b-back a-a-live from here, M-m-m-mustang will hear m-m-m-me."

13.content:
All was quiet in Station Square. Sonic was sleeping peacefully in his bed, a gentle breeze coming in fro the open window. But something else also came in through the window. A shadowy figure silently crept through and walked over to Sonic's bed. It stared hungrily at Sonic as he slept, unaware of the horror that was about to begin. The creature licked its chops as it bent over and prepared to feast.

Sunlight poured into Sonic's room. As Sonic opened his eyes he immediately closed them. It felt like his eyes were on fire. He reached into a drawer a pulled out a pair of sunglasses. He put them on and went into the bathroom. He looked itno the mirror and saw two marks on his neck. "What the?" He said. As he examined the marks his doorbell rang. "Coming!" He yelled as he went to the door.

When he answered, Tails was there. "Hi Sonic. Nice shades." Said Tails. "Thanks. Did you eat breakfast yet?" Asked Sonic. "No." Said Tails. "Well I was going to go to the diner in town, want to come?" Said Sonic. "Sure." Said Tails. When they got to the diner Sonic ordered steak and eggs. When it got to the table the steak was undercooked. Normally Sonic would have sent it back, but when he saw blood coming out from the bottom he suddenly was hungrier then before.

He picked up the steak and bit it. He sucked every last drop of blood from it. Tails stared at him in a odd way. "Are you OK Sonic?" He asked. "I'm fine." Said Sonic, getting up and going home.

1553.content:
Klara was not like your ordinary 16 year old, her black hair was long and wavy, but her deep purple eyes set her different from the other girl's. She had a hard time making friends with the other girls because they shunned her for her difference in appearance. You couldn't tell by looking at her that she was depressed, she always had a friendly smile on her face and the boys at the Montarshi Academy adored her, but she always felt as though her life was meaningless and that she was set for better things then this life.

The very next day Klara was on her way to school when she bumped into a very tall handsome boy, he had sleek blond hair and ice blue eyes. He smiled at her and took off down the road, he waved his hands frantically for her to follow him.
1553.title: Klara Honaru

choices: Klara decides to go through the wall

15531.content:
"Wait", she yells as she runs after him.

Klara can't believe her eyes as she rounds the corner, he has vanished in thin air! She has hit a dead end and there is nothing else to do, but go back the way she had came. She turns to go back when she hears a voice, she looks over, but no one is there. She feels as though she has gone insane, she saw a boy who had suddenly disappeared in thin air and now she is hearing voices.

"What is going on?" she asked herself.

"This way!" The voice whispered.

Klara walked up the the brick wall that was in front of her, she touched it. Her hand had went through the wall, it had completely disappeared from her site. Her eyes widened with fright and she pulled it back out. She stands there for a moment to think about whether or not she should go through it....

choices: She decides to take him up on his offer

155311.content:
Klara gets over her fear and decides to brave it onward through the wall, she gives it one last sigh before she enters into the darkness of the wall. It was a staircase with spiderwebs all over, she was terrified of spiders, but she knew that it was now or never and she still hadn't found that boy. She was certain that she would find something amazing through the walls, but she was mistaken.

Klara went down the stairs to find a bookstore, she saw the blue eyed boy sitting in the corner reading. She sighed to herself, she was afraid of this. Nothing exciting ever happens to her, she was just as dull as everyone else.

" It's about time you got here!" the boy sighed as he closed the book he was reading.

" Who are you?" Klara asked.

" I am Zero Nituro, and you are?" he asked as he moved closer towards her.

" I am Klara Honaru" she answered.

" So tell me Klara, are you tired of being dull and boring?" he asked as his blue eyes started to shine.

" Well yeah" she answered.

" I can make your wildest dreams come true, that is if you want it" he smiled.
155311.title: Klara decides to go through the wall

choices: Go after Zero and kill him
Protect humans against vampire attacks and then settle the score with Zero
1553111.content:
" I don't know? " She said with uncertainty.

" Very well, if you wanna be like all the other girls in this dank little town, be my guest!" Zero said mischeviously.

" Your right, risks are good to take so my answer is yes, make my wildest dreams come true" Klara said bravely as she could possibly manage.

" Very well" Zero grunted as his voice trailed off.

Zero walked over to Klara and pushed her against a wall, he could see the fear in eyes. He smiled to himself as he used his hands to keep her from getting out of his grip. Klara tried to scream, but nothing came out. She couldn't move and she wanted desperately to go home, but it was too late for that. It was too late to do anything, except wait and see what happens.

" It's only going to hurt for a little bit!" Zero said as he leaned over her.

As Zero leaned over her, towards her neck. Klara could see the fangs that was protruding out of his mouth, she let out a gasp as he sank his fangs into her neck. Klara started to feel weak, she could feel the life being drained out of her body. Suddenly everything turned black and she passed out.

As she awaken she could smell the blood on her neck, it was sickening at first, but then it started to smell sweet to her. She knew what she was admittedly, she was a vampire. Zero was no where to be found, he had left her there alone to die. That is what happened she had died and came back as a beast no longer a human.

She had to decide what she was going to do now, now that she was a vampire...
1553111.title: She decides to take him up on his offer

choices: go with Zero to Valaria Mountain
go home and act as though nothing has changed
15531111.content:
Klara was angry about what had happened to her and she wanted him to pay for his deception. Now that she was a vampire she had a keen sense of smell, she could smell him on her. She stood up and followed his essence, she could feel that she was catching up to him. She was very fast as well, she knew that once she caught up to him she would kill him, that's the way it had to be.

Klara ran up a ramp and jump down on him from above, they both rolled for a second on the ground. Klara and Zero both jumped to there feet as they stood staring at each other. Now that she found him, she was not sure what she was going to do. Klara had not thought it all the way through when she had decided to go after him.

" You told me you wanted a different life, I gave it to you!" Zero yelled at the purple eyed girl standing in front of him.

" You lied to me!" She retorted.

" So what know your going to kill me, by talking me to death?" He asked sarcastically with a laugh.

Klara had to think about it for a moment what she was going to do next, but she did have to admit she didn't think the plan all the way through. She was so angry at herself for letting it happen, she did nothing to deserve it. Then again she was complaining only moments before about how she was tired of being like everyone else, as she thought about it what she had done was ridiculous.

" Ugh...I guess not" She laughed.

" If you want you can come with me, I'm headed towards Valaria Mountain to see a friend of mine!" he stated.

That still didn't mean she had to like him or like what had happened, but know she had to decide where to go from there and what to do with her life.

info.brief_description: A character from a popoular series is turned into a vampire. Adventure/Horror story.
info.description:
Hello there, and welcome to my first Interactive story ever published on writing.com!

In this multiple choices story, a character coming from a popoular series of Anime/manga/videogames/cartoons/TV series, or even a book or a movie, if you prefer, will turn into a vampire for some reason.

From that moment on, he/she will get into an adventure, trying to heal from vampirism, or another character will do that for him/her. The main character and the other ones appearing in the story can be OOC (especially after the transformation). More than a character can be turned into a vampire. The story setting can be the series/original usual setting or a setting of your own creation. The story can have a horror/thriller atmosphere, but it's not obligatory.

And now some rules and suggestion to make this story enjoyable:

1)THIS IS NOT A FETISH/SEX RELATED STORY!

This is supposed to be an adventure story, so nothing related to vampire fetish or stuff like that. There can be love and sex scenes, but remember to keep them to a minimum (which means that, to describe such a scene, you'll have to be allusive and not explicit) and that the story in not centred on sex.

2)THIS IS AN ADVENTURE STORY, AND SO IT HAS TO BE AS MUCH ENTHRALLING AS POSSIBLE.

This means you have to unleash your creativity! Don't keep the story flat! Sensational developments, good dialogues (it'd be better if they are important for the story), well-done plots are welcome. Let's make the story more interesting as possible as the adventure goes on.

3) BAD WRITTEN STUFF OR POINTLESS FOUR-LINES CHAPTERS NOT ALLOWED!!!!

If you write here, you're supposed to know a little grammar and have a proper vocabulary. So, no pointless incredibly short chapters, no stuff which looks written by a two years old child, and make all the chapters you add have a little sense. Furthermore, every added chapter must have a perpetuity with the previous ones. This means that a chapter added without a reason related to the plot, even if good written, will be immediately deleted.

4) SINCE IT INVOLVES VAMPIRES, THERE CAN BE ALSO HORROR/TERRIFYING PARTS. BUT LET'S NOT EXAGGERATE WITH THE GORE LEVEL.

I mean, ok, some violence and bloody scenes are allowed, but don't make the story disgusting or too extreme.

And, last but not least, let's take this story seriously. It'd be a pity seeing many choices left blank.

Creative writers, I call on you!!! Let's make this story memorable!
Good luck everyone!
